attributes.action: A public holiday if Team GB finish above China in the medals team at Rio 2016
attributes.background:
If Team GB finish above China in the medals table, we should have a day's public holiday in the UK to celebrate this.

3rd place is the highest Team GB has ever finished an Olympic Games on foreign soil (1st in London 1908), so if we can beat the Chinese and finish second this would be crazy.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/olympics/rio-2016/medals/countries

336 GB athletes at Rio 2016 
412 Chinese athletes at Rio 2016

1.357 billion - population of China
64 million - population of UK

attributes.action: Create a train line along M25 with train stations near each junction.
attributes.background: M25 is a nightmare for commuters especially during peak hours. Commuters waste precious time sitting in long traffic queues around the  junctions such as J27, J21, J16, J15, J12 and Dartford crossing. Traffic on M25 is also adding to vehicular pollution.
attributes.additional_details: Creating a train line along M25 with train stations near each junction would ease the traffic on M25 and reduce vehicular pollution. This outer circle can then connect to all major train line that go into the Central London areas or going to other areas of the Country. Ample parking in these train stations will allow commuters to drive into the nearest station and hop onto trains. Local businesses around the train station will also benefit from the new investment.

attributes.action: Impose restrictions on corner shops / off-licence shops using plastic bags.
attributes.background: We saw clear decline of using plastic bags after imposing 5p charge which benefit the environment a great deal. It is time to impose restrictions or small charge on corner shops / takeaways /  off-licence shops  etc.This will further cut out the mess on our streets and will benefit small business

attributes.action: Additional EU Referendum for ALL Expats.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule to trigger an additional EU Referendum for all expatriate British Citizens, regardless of the length of time they have resided outside the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
If implemented the result of the June 2016 EU Referendum means the United Kingdom would leave the Worldâ€™s most influential network of nations on the base of a remarkably thin majority for such a huge step.
This is the decision of a lifetime to ALL British Citizens, wherever they live, yet the outcome was based on an undemocratic principle.
The millions of British citizens residing outside the UK are not only grass-roots ambassadors of the UK spread all over the planet but are affected by the result of the EU Referendum just as much as, if not more so, than UK residents.
However, millions of expats resident outside the UK for more than 15 years were not eligible to vote and were in effect disenfranchised. Therefore the result is not democratically legitimate.

attributes.action: Issue a two-year flight ban for travelers who cause disruption on airplanes
attributes.background: Airplane security is essential not only when combatting terrorism but for travelers to feel generally safe and ensure there are no added risks to flying. Recently, poor or drunken behaviour by some travelers has caused distress and has even required planes to be diverted.
attributes.additional_details: Increasingly there are stories of drunken and rowdy passengers causing problems on flights in and around Europe. Unfortunately, many of these are British travelers. At a time when airline safety is critical, this unwanted behaviour is creating added pressure and fining the travelers is often not a strong enough sanction. A two-year flight ban would hopefully be a more suitable sanction and also act as a deterrent.

attributes.action: Eye specialist, Moorfields, should decide who is fit to drive not the DVLA.
attributes.background: An Easterman eye test is not as conclusive as the DVLA believe. Some people cannot pass one but are still considered fit to drive but the DVLA will not listen to the specialists. Organisations like Moorfields should be able to say who is fit to drive. They are the professionals.

attributes.action: Make it law for individuals to return footballs if they land on their property
attributes.background: 1000's of footballs are held hostage each year by individuals who assume rights to the ball once it lands on their property. As parents of a very keen footballer, this has cost us a small fortune over the years and we would like to ask government to address this very hazy and unclear subject.

attributes.action: Road works on motorways should require 24/7 working.
attributes.background: Road works on motorways and major public roads should have 24/7 working to reduce loss of trade to local business and increased inconvenience to the UK population. The UK will be globally more effective and prosperous if the UK's transport links are more efficient.
attributes.additional_details: A short term pain, will lead to a long term gain.

attributes.action: Make bonfires a criminal offence except on 5 November and the nearest weekend
attributes.background: Bonfires are environmentally unfriendly and pollute the houses, gardens and washing of the people nearest to it. This can be a considerable radius depending on the atmospheric conditions. It is unacceptable for people to have to close their windows - whatever the weather - to keep smoke out.

attributes.action: Allow CCW in the UK for self defence
attributes.background: With violent crime at a whole time high in the UK.   And with the major threat of another terror attack,  it is a human right to be able to defend ourselves against this situation.  It is time for the right to CCW. (Conceal carry )   gun ownership for self defense can work in the UK.  Safely
attributes.additional_details: People always say the uk doesn't want to decommissioning another America when it comes to guns,  the media only report the criminal aspect of guns, they never report on the lives saved by the gun,  the crime stopped by the gun,   guns were banned after the Dunblane killings, but think.  If the kids were killed by a kitchen knife. Would the government have banned all kitchen knives, no..  gun ownership can work for self defense in the UK.  It is YOUR  human right to be able to protect yourself

attributes.action: Introduce PR to resolve the deep divisions created by the EU referendum.
attributes.background: Self-explanatory
attributes.additional_details: The referendum demanded a single answer to a complex question, was unbalanced in terms of outcome (one being final) and was decided by a narrow margin.

attributes.action: Full disclosure of Brexit negotiation & allowing a public referendum on the deal
attributes.background: The undersigned insist that David Davis or his successor & any persons that are involved will fully & openly disclose all details of the Brexit deal in detail they have negotiated. We also call on the government to allow the general public a vote on the negotiated deal as its them that are effected.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that it is only fair and right to allow them a vote on the deal that is negotiated in their name as it was back when we joined. People have the right to decide if the deal is the best for the country and the best way the country should go. We would also like to see the implementation of a set percentage of voters that will have to vote and carry the vote say 75% of the entire voting population with at least a 75% turn out of voting population in the UK and its territories.

attributes.action: Scrap the BBC and sell all assets for the NHS to save people Â£150 pa for life
attributes.background: The BBC has become an expensive white elephant with anything but a public service as its main goal. It is becoming extremely political and targeting minorities and politicians alike. It is time to make good use of its assets by selling it all and earmaking all proceeds to go to the NHS
attributes.additional_details:
The use of subliminal images by the BBC in targeting minorities or immigrants or even Scotland is disgusting. It has political agendas far beyond its remit and even targets politicians. Even if you do not like Jeremy Cobyn, one day it could be any other politician which does not serve the ultimate controller of the BBC.

The NHS which is depleted and suffering could make better use of these resources for the welfare of the nation. And people would be less taxed too by its excesses of the BBC.

attributes.action: Non paying parents living partners income should be taken in to consideration
attributes.background: Child Maintenance should take in to consideration a non paying parents partners income whom they live with. So many parents do not pay for their children and many of these parents are actually working with either being paid cash in hand or their income being paid in to there partners bank account.
attributes.additional_details: The CSA used to take the partners income in to consideration but was later changed. Now it is easier for the non paying parent to not pay for their child which means the child is going without! I believe as many others do that if the non paying parent claims to have no income (nill rate) or little to none income and is living with their partner who is supposedly supporting them then their partners income should be considered to help pay towards the non paying parents child.

attributes.action: Driving - Impose a compulsory ability re-test every 10 years for all UK drivers.
attributes.background: I propose that all drivers should be given an ability re-test every 10 years from the date of driving test pass. This is not a full test the same as the first driving test but an ability test to ensure all drivers are safe, aware, knowledgeable enough to handle the UK's roads safely.
attributes.additional_details:
In industry it is normal practice and a lawful H&S requirement to retest workers for various different skills (i.e. first aid, electrical safety, handling of heavy machinery) so why does this not apply to drivers? This will ensure only competent and safe drivers take to the roads. It will weed out those individuals who are no longer capable of driving a vehicle for whatever reason.
Those convicted of a serious motoring offence should also be ordered to take the test to re-gain their licence.

attributes.action: teachers to get a comparable fine to parents should they strike in term time
attributes.background: If parents taking children out of school during term for holidays damages children's education then the mass shut down of the schooling system must be worse, so the fines would be even between anyone stopping the education of our children including teachers

attributes.action: Fly British flags in major cities
attributes.background:
I would like to see as in so many other countries all public buildings flying the Union Jack, the National Flag ( St Georges cross for England and either the county or city flag.

Many other countries do this, I think the Uk should too. 

For example
attributes.additional_details:
I would like to see as in so many other countries all public buildings flying the Union Jack, the National Flag ( St Georges cross for England and either the county or city flag.

Many other countries do this, I think the Uk should too. 

For example

attributes.action: Urge the Governments in China, Vietnam & Asia to ban the Dog Meat Trade
attributes.background: I was physically sick when I saw a video on Facebook depicting the torturing to death of dogs for human consumption. The dogs are kept in horrific conditions & as sentient animals, feel the same emotions that we do. They are absolutely terrified. It is inhumane, barbaric & abhorrent & needs to stop
attributes.additional_details: The Yulin Dog Meat Festival & Asian Dog Meat Trade focuses on farming dogs for human consumption. Thousands of dogs are rammed into tiny cages, contorted & left to weaken. Dogs are happy animals & it is believed that their happiness & good health is passed onto those who eat them. The perpetrators think that torturing the dogs by blow torching & skinning them alive & battering their heads willl keep the meat tender. Videos & live Facebook appearances, notably by Ricky Gervais are ref points.

attributes.action: To establish a new bank holiday for the UK to be named "UK Diversity Day".
attributes.background: This day should be celebrated across the UK celebrating the contribution of the many diverse groups across a number of strands of UK society including Age, Disability, Gender, LGBT, Race and Religion. We are a great nation with a great history of embracing diversity and we should celebrate that.

attributes.action: Instigate a root & branch review of The FA
attributes.background: Following the dismal performances of the senior England football team in the European Championships it is time for an effective review of The FA and in particular the senior England set up.
attributes.additional_details: Having failed to qualify for the European championships in 2008 a root and branch review was allegedly carried out. This has clearly had no long lasting effect on the organisation and this  petition is to request that Tracey Crouch MP, Minister for Sport brings pressure upon the FA to carry out a full review of the circumstances surrounding the failings during this championship. This should include selection of inappropriate squad players.

attributes.action: Bring in informed consent legislation for elections and referendums.
attributes.background: It is currently legal for political bodies to use false or misleading information in the run up to a vote. Introducing Free, Prior, Informed Consent(FPIC) legislation for elections would hold politicians accountable for misleading or manipulating voters as well as make sure people are aware of risks
attributes.additional_details: Many voters have said they did not fully understand the EU referendum. Politicians used false figures and misleading information in official campaigns to manipulate votersâ€™ decisions. This impinges on votersâ€™ right to self-determination, because they were not fully informed. There is legislation to protect the same rights in other professions, there should also be similar ones for politics and government.

attributes.action: Make an application for EU membership no later than 1 year after leaving the EU
attributes.background:
Many people who voted to leave the European Union in the June 2016 referendum have changed their minds and a clear message that EU reform is needed has been sent and, we hope, received. 
We wish, in the interests of unity and prosperity, to reclaim the UK's place in the EU.

attributes.action: Build new coal fired power stations using low carbon emission technology..
attributes.background:
We have learned that Germany will build new coal fired power stations despite urging us to close ours.
By re-opening the UK's coal mines and building new power stations utilising low carbon technology, we can secure our country's energy needs for the forseeable future.

attributes.action: Free prescription charges for, Spondylitis/Fibromyalgia/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
attributes.background: Spondylitis/Fibromyalgia/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome are auto-immune diseases effecting more than 500,000 people in the UK. Currently there is no cure, so the only way to manage the pain and flare up's is to take medication, taking 20 tablets+ daily.
attributes.additional_details: I am petitioning for, any Spondylitis/Fibromyalgia/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome/Lupus sufferers to be given free prescriptions and and all above named conditions be added to the NHS exemption list. These conditions can affect any of us, no matter what age. Having to pay for prescriptions or prescription-pre-payment cards till you are 60 is not fair, they need to be added to the medical exemption format.

attributes.action: now that the British people have voted , we need an updated  magna carta
attributes.background: now that the British people have voted to leave the eu, one of the wrongs needs to be righted, a British bill of rights is needed to include an updated people's magna Carta to include the original laws but updated for the 21st century, also if possible to be signed &  agreed by the head of state
attributes.additional_details: the magna Carta was signed by the then head of state king John, to protect the people's rights for lawful imgresses, parts of the laws were watered down or revoked by various people over the centuries, therefore losing said rights, but some still stand as of today & as this was the peoples choice to leave the eu, those in charge, parliment etc, should now be held accountable by the said people as/if the  need arises

attributes.action: Make it legal to listen to broadcasts not meant for the general public. (ATC)
attributes.background: It is illegal to provide air traffic control feeds from within the UK due to an outdated law that originated in 1942. The law states that although it is not illegal to sell, buy or own a scanning receiver in the UK, it must only be used to listen to transmissions meant to be broadcast to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
OfCom (the U.K. regulatory authority for communications) has stated on numerous occasions: "It is an offence to listen to any other radio services unless you are authorised by a designated person to do so." 

This means that it is illegal to listen to anything other than general reception. This is clearly a law that needs to be updated in light of the many educational uses for listening to aircraft communications. Furthermore, the original reasons for this law have long since become irrelevant.

attributes.action: Propose a referendum on whether or not HM Government should trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum and the fact UK citizens can now see it's effect more clearly and are better informed of future plans, we the undersigned propose HM Government hold a further referendum on whether or not to trigger Article50. The result of this should then determine a 2nd referendum.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is due to the sheer number of people expressing they voted incorrectly to leave, some as a "dissatisfaction" vote and the fact the vote was too close to be a satisfactory result. Also the backtracking on spending proposals (eg NHS) clearly left many feeling deceived by the out campaign. UK citizens deserve honesty and integrity from their leaders to make truely informed decisions and that did not happen.

attributes.action: If 2nd referendum occurs, change rules. Give 16+ & expats ex uk 15 + yrs a vote.
attributes.background:
Before any new referendum Lower the voting age to 16
Allow expats out of the uk more than 15 years to have a vote
attributes.additional_details:
* The younger generation should be allowed to have a say on their own future. Not have it made for them by a much older generation.

* Expats like me, British passport , ex British army but lived in another member state, ( and have a business France for 16 years promoting and selling uk products ) were not allowed a say on such an important vote.

attributes.action: Restore the historic boundary of Warwickshire.
attributes.background:
In 1974 the county of Warwickshire was broken up to make the fictitious region of West Midlands.
The local government act 1972 change Warwickshire's boundaries and took out the major cities.
Birmingham, Coventry, Edgbaston, Solihull, Sutton Coldfield and other area's should be returned.
attributes.additional_details: Edgbaston is the home of Warwickshire county cricket club.

attributes.action: Make petrol tax cheaper for sports car drivers
attributes.background: Because driving and running costs are already a lot. Petrol shouldn't be over priced so people can't drive how they want to drive Thierry performance cars

attributes.action: Not to invoke Article 50 until the year 2026.
attributes.background:
Leaving the EU because a political party used the promise of an in out referendum on our European membership as an electoral bribe was both ethically and morally wrong. 
For this, and many other reasons, I feel that a prolonged period of reflection is needed before Article 50 is invoked.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement to hold a UK Election within a year of any change of PM
attributes.background: New PM'S should have a mandate from the people they govern, rather than a few party members.  As such a new UK GENERAL Election should be held within 1 year of a new PM being appointed so he or she can claim to lead the People as PM with a proper mandate.

attributes.action: Set a date for a Scotland independence referendum
attributes.background: The U.K. Eu referendum result is not supported by the majority in Scotland. A further referendum should be run to determine if Scotland wishes to remain in Europe.

attributes.action: Remove the 'triple lock' on pensions and protect the NHS from further cuts
attributes.background: Over 70% of pensioners backed the Leave vote to force Britain out of the EU and likely into a recession. The taxpayer pays more for pensions, than for healthcare, but unlike health the 'triple lock' on pensions guarantees increases of at least 2.5%, inflation or average earnings, whichever is higher
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015, Â£150bn was spent of taxpayer money on pensioners who voted to leave the EU. This looks certain to mean another recession and another round of austerity. The NHS can't take any more cuts, we were told during the referendum, so let's protect healthcare spending and cut pensions for those who clearly think we can afford a recession.
http://www.ukpublicspending.co.uk/budget_pie_ukgs.php

attributes.action: Abolish the monarchy and the house of lords as UK voted for democracy.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to abolish the monarchy and the house of lords as they are unelected and a barrier to having a full democracy in the UK. This is something that has proven to be a public priority with it helping to secure a leave vote in the recent EU referendum.

attributes.action: For EU motions to be urgently debated in Parliament offering a range of outcomes
attributes.background: Next steps for Parliament is far from clear or defined in law. An urgent Commons debate should offer a range of motions from each side of the campaign with full analysis of issues and offering a range of options moving forward. Any parliamentary outcome should be accompanied by wider consultation.

attributes.action: Build a new Royal Yacht Britannia with British Steel, Workers & apprentices.
attributes.background:
Following the EU referendum, we should build a new Royal Yacht Britannia using British Steel, British Workers and training British apprentices. 

Britannia would be a Flag Ship for a newly invigorated Britain sailing the oceans of the world promoting the UK globally as a free trading nation.
attributes.additional_details: This is a perfect opportunity to invest British money in a project that will create British jobs, train British apprentices and produce a fully British product.  The Royal family will once again be able to showcase British engineering and design at its best whilst visiting countries all over the world establishing and building relationships that will pave the way for trade deals with our Global partners.

attributes.action: Don't Hold a General Election on account of result of EU Referendum
attributes.background:
The UK has now entered a period of unparalleled uncertainty and this uncertainty is the biggest threat to continuing UK financial stability. 
Financial markets are already unsettled as it is, and a General Election would prolong the uncertainty and economic fallout of Brexit, at everyone's expense.
attributes.additional_details: Uncertainty over the outcome of the EU Referendum already had a significant impact on the UK economy prior to this vote, with foreign direct investment being put on hold as well as stock markets and sterling becoming increasingly volatile. Now a vote to leave has prolonged this period of uncertainty and is likely to have a significant short term economic impact. It is vital that a General Election is not called to ensure that the financial fallout of Brexit is not prolonged for UK households.

attributes.action: Force childcare providers to cap escalating and over priced childcare costs
attributes.background: Since my son has been in private nursery, we have paid Â£14000. My son has been in nursery for 13 months! Over the course of two years, we would have paid Â£25000 which is enough for a deposit on a house. This is obscene and believe that childcare should be capped to no more than Â£45 per day.
attributes.additional_details: Not only do parents have to pay for bank holidays but also for family holidays making it near impossible to go on holiday for some families. Many parents earn nothing after paying childcare fees but yet we are urged to work. With some childcare providers charging in excess of Â£90 per day, how are we supposed to pay these costs?

attributes.action: Compel Bookmakers to accept Â£100 wagers and ban closing accounts
attributes.background: Bookmakers are systematically closing accounts of any punter with even short term profits.this is totally contrary to them being licenced to accepting bets.A modest figure of Â£100 would hardly lay them open to nefarious acts but would equally give a fair deal.
attributes.additional_details: I am sure several thousands respondents will support this ,all with similar stories.

attributes.action: Stop allowing supermarkets to sell cheap alcohol.
attributes.background: The Pub Trade is dying, supermarkets are allowed to sell cheap alcohol which allows people to drink to excess and cause more stress on the NHS Police and other emergency services.  pubs are not allowed to do this by law.
attributes.additional_details:
All the major supermarkets are allowed to do the promotions i.e selling a litre of Vodka for aprox Â£15.
This stops people visiting bars and keeping them alive, pubs are being turned into shops and the community is losing out with having no where to go to celebrate birthdays etc.
We need to act now and save our pub's and clubs from disappearing .

attributes.action: Require all computer operating systems have up/down scroll bar arrows.
attributes.background: For the past four years the Apple operating system, Mac OS X has had no up/down arrows on it's scroll bar. This was a none optional global change, so affects all software run in Mac OS X, even if it isn't Apple software. This causes difficulties for some disabled people and none disabled people too.
attributes.additional_details:
https://discussions.apple.com/thread/3196331?tstart=0
http://www.quicken.com/support/scrollbar-arrows-missing-using-quicken-lion-os
http://reverttosaved.com/2015/02/18/access-all-areas-why-even-apple-needs-to-rethink-regarding-accessibility/
https://discussions.apple.com/message/30209946#30209946
http://www.macworld.co.uk/news/mac/opinion-whats-wrong-mountain-lion-interface-3425603/

attributes.action: Replace extortionate fees (24%) charged to parents by CMS with standard fee.
attributes.background: Paying parent pays 20% - receiving parent pays 4% to CMS for setting up direct debit.  Fees are disproportionate to the effort required by CMS to effect payment.  Fees are significantly more than fees charged to make simple bank transfer or BACS payment, regardless of the amount involved.
attributes.additional_details: The 24% charge is a standard charge, whether payment is Â£1 or Â£1000.  This fee amounts to a lot for some paying parents and represents money that could be better spent on the children.  The CMS should at least explain the reasons for this extortionate fee level, and be transparent about what they actually do to deserve such a fee.  Monies already paid by parents should receive a refund along the lines of the PPI scandal.  (Will give CMS something to do!)

attributes.action: Reform faith school's religious studies to follow the National Curriculum
attributes.background:
Faith schools are mostly run like other state schools. They have to follow the national curriculum except for religious studies, where they are free to only teach about their own religion.

The exclusion of other religions does not open students to other faiths and promotes ignorance.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/types-of-school/faith-schools

attributes.action: Stop the NHS sharing patient records with third parties (e.g. Google).
attributes.background:
Patient records are confidential and should be available only to patients and healthcare professionals directly involved in their care.
Allowing access by third parties could, and almost certainly will, lead to improper use by insurance companies and marketing agencies.
attributes.additional_details: Sharing a patient's medical record with a third party should require specific authorisation by the patient.

attributes.action: Make Mondays part of the weekend every week.
attributes.background: We all work too hard and we need more time off.
attributes.additional_details: It's as simple as that.

attributes.action: Increase refuge spaces for male survivors of domestic violence
attributes.background: Currently there are only 11 government funded refuge places for male survivors of domestic violence yet 40% of domestic violence is against males

attributes.action: Put a cap on the monthly rent payments for individuals in the UK
attributes.background: In the county of Dorset the average rent payment for an individual is Â£400 per month. If an individual is earning the minimum UK wage at Â£7.00, and working a 40 hour week, this means that almost 50% of their earnings are going towards paying their landlord.
attributes.additional_details:
Considering the high expense of life in general, including rates for food and living costs, car insurance, telephone bills and the other monthly expenditures, this means that tenants are paying a high rate for other important items.
Considering this, the base line is that we in the UK are LIVING TO WORK. This has to change.

My intention is that parliament puts a cap for landlords at 30% of a monthly wage based on minimum wage for tenants in each county.

attributes.action: Spend revenue from closing tax loopholes on carbon capture & storage technology
attributes.background: I think a percentage of the money the government gains from closing tax loopholes should be invested. The single biggest threat facing the world is global warming. A lot of money is being invested in renewables but not enough into capturing carbon from existing fossil fuel consumption.
attributes.additional_details: There is a technology called Carbon Capture & Storage (CCS). This captures up to 90% of the carbon from fossil fuel power stations and other industry when it is fitted. If more money was invested in this technology, it would reduce the manufacturing cost more companies could start fitting it to new power stations and possibly existing power stations and industry thus reducing emissions.

attributes.action: Allow katy James to stay in the Uk with her husband and 2 year old daughter!
attributes.background:
Katy has been married to her husband Dominic for 9 years and they have a 2 year old daughter, Katy has been denied a visa because her husband doesn't "earn enough"

This is unfair and no parent should be seperated from their child
